title: Automation Engineer
description:
**Be part of something altogether life-changing**


Working at Cytiva in the Life Sciences industry means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.


At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. With associates across 40 countries, Cytiva is a place where every day is a learning opportunity – so you can grow your career and expand your skills in the long term.


Cytiva is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives.


We're looking for an ***Automation Engineer*** to join the Custom Engineer, Life Cycle Management department at our site in Uppsala.


As an Automation Engineer you will be working in a quality focused, dynamic environment in a team of 12, with long experience and deep knowledge of CE, our products and customers.


You will be responsible for product care of products, by keeping track, monitor, support and coordinate activities, changes and improvements for those products.

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**

* Be part of the Change Control Board (CCB) core team and responsible for activities associated with change requests (ECR´s/ECO´s) for existing pre-defined and configurable product offerings. You will make investigations, suggest solutions and implement approved changes.
* Engaged in all phases of life cycle management and sustaining engineering including planning, design, development, documentation, test, supplier interfaces, manufacturing and service support
* Participate in technical reviews meetings and collaborative technical forums with customer projects
* Involved in standardization activities for CE custom products
* Address cases from customers complains with insight and address the needs


You will make use of your strong collaboration skills working in cross functional project teams, and engage in all phases of life cycle management and sustaining engineering including planning, design, development, documentation, test, supplier interfaces, manufacturing and service support

 **Key responsibilities in this role include:**

* Participate in technical reviews meetings and collaborative technical forums
* Involved in standardization activities for CE custom products
* Address cases from customers complains with insight and address the needs
* Coordinate with different team members, or other disciplines, the implementation of the changes and improvements for the product.
* Actively participate in improvement forums and activities to further develop or support different roles within the organization

**The essential requirements of the job include:**

* BSc in Automation Engineering or equivalent experience.
* Experience in Rockwell and Siemens platforms.
* Wide regulatory knowledge about safety of machinery.
* Experience in UNICORN controlled systems is desirable.
* Experience in industrial field bus technologies.
* Knowledge of industry and/or academic practices and standards related to structural analysis, finite element analysis, and structural verification testing.
* Professional level English skills, both written and oral. Fluency in Swedish is a great advantage.

**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**

* Experience and knowledge in automation engineering, establishing requirements specifications and writing technical reports.
* Experience in AutoCAD and EPLAN software.


To be successful in this role, we're looking for an energized and results-oriented self-starter with great communication skills. Whether you're a seasoned engineer or newly graduated isn't the most important, what matters is your drive and passion for automation design and technology.


Interview and selection will happen continuously, so please apply as soon as possible. For questions regarding the role please contact hiring manager Catalin Andrei at catalin.andrei@cytiva.com


We look forward to hearing from you!

**Danaher**


Cytiva, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job.


Check out our benefits at Danaher Benefits Info.


Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.


At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
company_description: Cytiva is a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics, addressing urgent needs and helping save patient lives.

title: Embedded Test Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about embedded systems and quality assurance? Do you thrive in a collaborative, product-driven environment where your work has a direct impact? We are looking for a skilled **Embedded Test Engineer** to join our client in **Malmö**!

**About the company**


Mero are happy to support our client with a Functional Tester where you will work deeply integrated with the Software Quality team with the goal of delivering the world’s most advanced and intuitive products within the field. The company is developing a product for consumers, and you will have colleagues both globally and locally in Malmö. We will provide more information about the company at the next step of the recruitment.


You will be hired as a consultant for the first 6 months, with the possibility for an extension.

**About the Role**


In the role you will participate in the analysis of test plans and requirements, organization and validation of documentation, writing and executing test cases, open issues providing debugging information, performing manual tests and automating test cases. Your role includes:

* Analyze features scope, functional and system requirements.
* Participate in the joint development and follow up of test plans, with QA Certifi-cation Managers, Program Managers and Testing Teams.
* Review the quality and completeness of documentation.
* Follow up version control, releases and changelog documentation.
* Define, write and execute manual test cases.
* Define and write automated test cases. Due to the nature of the system, this is mostly accomplished using python language.
* Validate releases and provide support to the Integration Test team.
* Create and track issue logs, review externally created issues.

**Your knowledge & Experience**


To succeed in this role, we think that you have a degree in Engineering, Computer Science, IT or a related technical field combined with proficiency in Functional Testing of **embedded software systems**. You are also skilled in **Linux administration**, automation and installation combined with great knowledge in testing tools such as Xray are a big advantages.


You also need to be fluent in English. Experience & Skills within automated testing in Python is a big plus but not required if you have technical interest and drive to learn.

**Who are you?**


To thrive in this role, we believe that you should be driven and bring enthusiasm to customers and colleagues. You must be committed to excellence, ensuring that you deliver promises with focus, accountability, and discipline. Innovation is a big part of the culture, so you should be open to thinking differently, taking risks, and continuously improving. Success here is also about winning as a team, so you should embrace collaboration, leverage the strengths of others, and invest in team growth.

**Other information**


If you have any questions about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Joakim Gullin at Joakim@mero.se or 0709-700016. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible as we are conducting a continuous selection process.


We look forward to your application!

title: Manager Technology & Maintenance
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0054148
**Date Posted:**

2024-12-20
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The Opportunity**  

The High Power Laboratory is accredited according to ISO/IEC 17025 as an independent testing station and is a member of SATS Certification and STL (Short-circuit Testing Liaison) and we are one of the few unique High Power Laboratories in the world. The Laboratory is a large test facility for high voltage products with a variety of non-routine electrical and mechanical test procedures. Its main purpose is to perform high quality testing, both in the development of new products, and in certification of the products for a global market.  



  

Being a part of, and responsible of, the support function, Technology & Maintenance, at the High-Power Laboratory is an important and interesting challenge as well as a key role to keep the Laboratory organization and operation at the forefront.  

  



The team, that consists of approx. 12 persons, handles both hardware and software for projects, systems, updates, investments, maintenance and engineer support to five different Laboratories and a workshop within the organization.  

  



We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with, so we encourage you to apply even though you might not meet all requirements.  

  



**How you´ll make an impact**  

* Drive a positive team culture within the Laboratory, covering both technology, maintenance, facility and Infrastructure.
* Understand and support the need from the Laboratory units, then drive the actions that need to be taken.
* As a member of the management team, you will report the status of projects and key targets.
* Support quality audits within the various functions in the Laboratory.
* Contribute to strategic planning and the development of the Laboratory.
* Responsible of the overall performance for this department.
**Your background**  

* Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or a related field. Comparable acquired competence may also be considered.
* Proven managerial experience for at least 5 years.
* Experience of successfully driving team culture and implementing continuous improvement initia-tives, preferably within an engineering environment.
* Familiarity with production engineering, RnD, and or, Design is a plus.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a drive for identifying trends and proposing innova-tive solutions.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and influencing skills to collaborate effectively with stake-holders.
**What we offer**  

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks
**More about us**  

Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are ready for you! Applications will be screened on an ongoing basis so we encourage you to apply today.
  

  

Recruiting manager Tomas Bergström, tomas.bergstrom@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. title: Systemutvecklare

description:

 systems and

 of experience with

title: Development Engineer
Senior Backendutvecklare Java
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Mikrotjänstarkitektur i backend på Java Spring Boot.
* Design av återanvändbara backendtjänster.
* Implementation av och integration mot affärssystem.
* Förflyttning och konsolidering av förmågor, gärna inom bank och/eller försäkring.
* Detaljera högnivåarkitektur från dokument till körbar kod.
* Tekniker som Kubernetes (gärna Redhat Openshift), Java Spring Boot, mikrotjänstarkitektur.
* 7+ års arbetslivserfarenhet som Backendutvecklare.


**Meriterande**
* Att arbeta i en reglerad bransch såsom bank eller försäkring.
* Event-baserade arkitekturmönster.
* Integration mot mainframe-miljöer och -system.
* Utveckling på och av en standardiserad utvecklingsplattform (IDP).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt DevOps- och SRE-principer.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 30-03-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: GCP Data Engineer Stockholm
description:
**GCP Data Engineer**
 Do you want to build the next data models for AI, ML, and data warehouse-powered solutions?
   

  

 Nexer Insight invites you to embark on a journey as a
 **GCP Data Engineer** 
 , where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits.
   

  

 Do you want to be our next
 **”** 
**Data Ninja** 
**”** 
**?**
 Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to work with cutting-edge technologies on
 **Google Cloud** 
 , including BigQuery, Dataflow, and Dataproc. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities.
   

  

 Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
* Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
* Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
* Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
* Leverage Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
* Propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.


**What We** 
**’** 
**re Looking For**
 Based on our criteria for the role, we expect you to have:
   

  

* Minimum 5 years of experience working as a Data Engineer.
* Minimum 2 years of hands-on project experience of working with GCP.
* Experience working with ETL tools such as BigQuery, Dataflow, Dataproc, or DBT.
* Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture.
* In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax.
* Experience in information and dimensional modelling.
* Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.


**Meritorious Experience**
* Certifications such as Google Cloud Professional Data Engineer.
* Experience in Governance tools for GCP , for an exaple Data Catalogue
* Platform modernisation.
* Experience with Google Cloud Infrastructure setup.
* Data Vault modelling.


**Why Join Us?**
 At Nexer Insight, you'll work with the latest technology in data engineering while being part of a supportive and innovative team. We are proud of our commitment to personal growth, offering certifications, training, and exciting projects with leading clients.
   

  

 Apply today to become part of Nexer Insight's jour

title: Senior Developer till Kleer
description:
**💛 It all comes Kleer – PE Accounting byter namn**
 Kleer (tidigare PE Accounting) grundades för att revolutionera ekonomi- och lönebranschen genom ledande teknik och ekonomiexpertis. Idag erbjuder vi marknadens mest automatiserade system med över 80% automationsgrad, men vi stannar inte där – vi vill mer. Vi blir Kleer!
   

  

**Vill du vara med på resan? Blir en del av vårt team som senior utvecklare!**
 👉🏼 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade utvecklare vars dagliga arbete & åsikter är avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt. Som utvecklare på Kleer arbetar du i en helt egenutvecklad produkt, som vi utvecklar och produktionssätter och du får stor kreativ frihet och möjligheter att ständigt växa i rollen som utvecklare på Kleer! Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida
   

  

**Vår Utvecklingsmiljö**
 Vi är ett produktbolag med en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror starkt på att det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter. Därför arbetar varje squad med en del av applikationen, men i hela teknikstacken. Vårt inhouse-utvecklingsteam består idag av utvecklare fördelat på 5 team, där teamen samarbetar nära en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

 Kodbasen, som till största del är skriven i Java, är välskriven och vi kvalitetssäkrar vår kod genom automatiserade tester. Vi uppgraderar löpande till senaste versionen av våra verktyg och tredjepartskomponenter. Hela miljön är containerbaserad och releaser görs veckovis.
   

  

 Vi har ett helt nytt, fräscht och påkostat kontor i centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) där vi möts, tar en pingismatch, utbyter idéer och samlas runt en whiteboard eller för ett retrospective. Vi vet att även flexibilitet i vardagen är viktigt, därför finns det även möjligheten att arbeta remote!
   

  

**Rollen Som Senior Developer På Kleer**
 Som Senior Developer hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att utveckla och förbättra vår produkt samt bidra till företagets tekniska resa framåt. Vi tror att du trivs i ett modernt produktbolag och i en roll där du får chans att verkligen vara med och påverka produkten och utvecklingen av den.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden i rollen 👇🏼
   

  

* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från kravspecifikation till implementering
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, Engineering Manager och teammedlemmar för att säkerställa att produktens vision och tekniska mål uppnås
* Ett tekniskt ansvar för en del av applikationen när det kommer till datamodell, arkitektur, prestanda, säkerhet m.m.
* Bidra med din tekniska expertis och erfarenhet för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java samt SQL och du är inte rädd för att komma med egna tankar och idéer som vi tillsammans förverkligar! Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat. Som person är du nyfiken och motiveras av att testa och lära dig nya saker inom ditt område.
   

  

**Mer Om Kleer Som Bolag**
 Vi grundades 2011 och är ett modernt & värderingsstyrt produktbolag. I över 12 år har vi skapat innovation och hjälpt små & medelstora bolag att automatisera sin ekonomi. Vi har en väldigt stabil affärsmodell som bolag och växer organiskt, med sunda finanser - vilket bland annat har gjort oss till sexfaldiga DI Gaseller. I skrivande stund närmar vi oss 200 kollegor och finns med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö.
   

  

*Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra ifrån dig!*
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

*Sökord: Java 19, Spring, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.*
 Vi på Kleer ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: Tech Lead - Digital Asset Management
description:
**Solve complex problems. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people, and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

**About the organization:**
 At Electrolux, we are leading a Digital Transformation that aims to deliver world-class Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) solutions through our Consumer Direct Interaction Organization (CDI XO). With a focus on innovation, we are driving growth and delivering cutting-edge experiences across Europe, APAC, and the Americas.
   

  

 As a key player in this transformation, you will help shape the future of our digital solutions, ensuring the highest quality and smooth execution. You’ll be working in a fast-paced, high-energy environment within a digital product organization, collaborating across multiple Agile Release Trains. The initiatives you will lead are at the forefront of our strategic initiatives, and your contributions will directly impact our success.
   

  

**All about the role:**
 As a Tech Lead - Digital Asset Management, you will take ownership of developing and integrating the DAM (Digital Asset Management) software with the existing PIM eco-system, ensuring seamless data flow and functionality for the content creators & sales channels. Your role will involve interacting with senior leaders, product owners, and content creators, ensuring alignment across teams, and driving timely, high-quality delivery.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Development and Integration: Developing and integrating DAM (we use Bynder) software with existing upstream and downstream systems, ensuring seamless data flow and functionality.
* Metadata Management: Creating, updating, and managing metadata to improve searchability and retrieval of digital assets.
* Workflow Management: Developing and managing workflows for the creation, approval, and distribution of digital assets such as product images & videos.
* Continuous Improvement: Implementing continuous integration and deployment practices to ensure regular updates and improvements to the DAM system.
* User support: Providing support and training to users, ensuring they can effectively use the DAM system.
* Stakeholder Management: Communicate effectively with stakeholders in product lines, marketing, IT & sales


**Who you are:**
* 5+ years of experience as a software developer building/ configuring Production Information Management system and/or Digital Asset management systems in a B2C company.
* Minimum 2 years of demonstrated hands-on experience with Restful APIs and JSON payloads.
* Strong knowledge of CMS platforms (essential)
* Proficiency in writing code using one of the following, .Net, C#, JavaScript (essential)
* Strong technical background with a desire to be hands on, coding up to 70% of the time
* Passion for mentoring and coaching other developers, with a desire to step into a team lead role
* Familiarity with cloud infrastructure, particularly Azure, is a plus.
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate effectively across technical and product teams.


**You demonstrate:**
* Collaboration – You contribute to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross-functional team to flourish.
* Communication - You communicate clearly and persuasively, confidently partnering with stakeholders at all levels in the company. You are tactical and have a strategic ability to communicate, build relationships with key stakeholders, and influence others
* Problem-Solving – You are able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated.
* Project Management - Ability to build high performing teams based on teamship and cross-functional collaboration.
* Adaptability & Resilience – You can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach. You have a strong sense of urgency.
* Prioritization: You can manage a high workload with speed and accuracy by prioritizing regularly. You have a strong sense of urgency


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position in one of our Electrolux Office in
 **Stockholm, Sweden.** 
 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family-friendly benefits
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.


**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
**Find out more:**
 Electrolux Group

title: Lead Developer
description:
*Vi söker en driven och erfaren individ som är redo att ta nästa steg i sin karriär som Lead Developer. Om du är redo att leda utvecklingsteamet framåt och bidra med din tekniska expertis kommer du att trivas i denna innovativa och framåtskridande roll. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att påverka och utveckla framtidens teknik.*
 Lead Developer på Advania 🚀
   

  

 På vårt affärsområde ansvarar vi för att utveckla och förbättra avancerade tekniska lösningar för våra kunder. Som Lead Developer hos oss arbetar du med att leda ett team av utvecklare samtidigt som du själv är aktiv i utvecklingsprocessen. Du kommer att:
   

  

  

* Utforma och implementera robusta och effektiva mjukvarulösningar.
* Coacha och stötta ett team av duktiga utvecklare.
* Kommunicera med intressenter för att säkerställa projektens framgång.
* Driva tekniska projekt från koncept till lansering.


 Utöver dessa uppgifter ansvarar du även för att säkerställa att våra utvecklingsprocesser är både effektiva och moderna. Rollen är baserad i Stockholm.
   

  

*Det unika med denna roll är möjligheten att ha en direkt påverkan på vår tekniska riktning och utvecklingsmetodik, med stora möjligheter till både personlig och professionell utveckling.*
 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 För att du ska trivas och passa hos oss söker vi dig som har en bakgrund inom systemutveckling och teknisk projektledning. Du arbetar idag i en roll som teknisk ledare eller senior utvecklare. Som person motiveras du av att lösa komplexa problem, leda och stötta teamet, och driva projekt framåt. Du trivs i en miljö där samarbete och innovation ligger i fokus.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

  

* Minst fem års erfarenhet av utveckling i programmeringsspråk som ASP.NET, C#, Javascript
* God erfarenhet av att jobba med APIer.
* Kompetens inom Azure Cloud.
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Genesys Cloud.


 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.
